isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 Transmission - Automatic Transaxle/Transmission - 5R110 - Diagnostic Trouble Code Index

note.para: Some of the following DTC code symptoms may experience multiple DTC code symptoms. The loss of one or more gears could be experienced depending on transmission condition.

entry.para: TR-P sensor signal frequency is out of normal range.
Only REVERSE, NEUTRAL and 5th gear detected. Engine may not crank.
TR-P sensor circuit duty cycle low input.
TR-P sensor signal duty cycle is below threshold, sensor/circuit electrical malfunction.
Only REVERSE, NEUTRAL and 5th gear detected. Engine may not crank.
TR-P sensor circuit duty cycle high input.
TR-P sensor signal duty cycle is above threshold, sensor/circuit electrical malfunction.
Only REVERSE, NEUTRAL and 5th gear detected. Engine may not crank.
Only REVERSE, NEUTRAL and 5th gear detected. Engine may not crank.
TR-P sensor not in P or N positions during KOEO or KOER.
KOEO or KOER not run in P or N positions, or TR-P sensor circuit failure.
RERUN KOEO and KOER in P or N position. GO to Pinpoint Test C.
No change if TFT during operation.
TCM has detected no TFT change during operation. TFT value stuck at some normal reading.
Voltage drop across TFT sensor exceeds scale set for temperature of 157°C (315°F).
Voltage drop across TFT sensor exceeds scale set for temperature of -40°C (-40°F).
TFT out of range during on-board diagnos- tics.
Transmission not operating at temperature during on-board diagnostics.
DTC set: engine cold or overheated.
Warm or cool engine to normal operating temperature. GO to Pinpoint Test B.
Torque converter engages earlier than expected.
TCM detected a loss of TSS signal during operation.
Harsh shifts and engagements, engine rpm higher or lower than expected. No 1st, 3rd or 5th gear.
TCM has not detected a TSS signal.
Harsh shifts and engagements, engine rpm higher or lower than expected. No 1st, 3rd or 5th gear.
TCM has detected a noisy TSS signal.
TCM detected a loss of OSS signal during operation.
TCM has detected a noisy OSS signal.
TCM has detected no OSS signal.
CAN link error detected by TCM. Loss of communication with the ECM.
Only reverse, neutral and 5th gears are available.
Refer to the Powertrain Control/ Emissions Diagnosis (PC/ED) manual.
Clutch Control Solenoid or Internal Parts
TCM has detected a gear ratio error. OWC clutch or clutches may have failed.

Incorrect gear selection depending on failure or mode and manual lever position. Shift errors may also be due to other internal transmission concerns (stuck valves, damaged friction material). Engine rpm could be higher or lower than expected. May flash TCIL.

REFER to PID P0730_Status Chart, found immediately after Output State Control (OSC) Mode in this section, for a specific failure. REFER to the Solenoid Application charts located at the beginning of Pinpoint Tests - OSC Equipped Vehicles. If other solenoid DTCs are present, GO to Pinpoint Test A. If only P0730 is present, INSTALL the appropriate clutch solenoid. CLEAR DTCs, road test. If the concern is still present, REPAIR/INSTALL new internal transmission components.
P0740 (Output circuit check, generated only by electronical symptoms.)
TCC solenoid circuit fails to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit open.
TCC solenoid circuit perform- ance error.
Torque converter slippage detected during engagement command indicating a concern with mechanical or hydraulic operation of the converter clutch.
TCC solenoid circuit shorted to ground.
TCC solenoid circuit fails to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Shorted to ground.
Short circuit: Only 5th gear at low vehicle speeds.
TCC solenoid circuit fails to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit open, shorted or TCM driver failure during on-board diagnostics.
Short circuit: Only 5th gear at lower speeds.
TCC solenoid circuit shorted to power.
TCC solenoid circuit fails to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit shorted to power.
TCC solenoid circuit perform- ance error.
Torque converter slippage detected during engagement command indicating a concern with mechanical or hydraulic operation of the converter clutch.
Voltage through PC-A solenoid is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded.
Open circuit: maximum PC-A pressure, harsh engagements and shifts. Engine rpm higher than expected.
Short circuit: Maximum PC-A pressure, harsh engagements and shifts. Engine rpm higher than expected.
Voltage through PC-A solenoid is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded.
Open circuit: maximum PC-A pressure, harsh engagements and shifts. Engine rpm higher than expected.
PC-A solenoid short to ground circuit failure.
Voltage through PC-A solenoid is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded.
PC-A solenoid short to power circuit failure.
Voltage through PC-A solenoid is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded.
Maximum PC-A pressure, harsh engagements and shifts. Engine rpm higher than expected.
SSPC-A circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit open or TCM driver failure during on-board diagnostics.
SSPC-A circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - OFF.
SSPC-A circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the OFF position during operation resulting in HIGH pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-A circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - ON.
SSPC-A circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the ON position during operation resulting in LOW pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-A circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit failure or TCM driver failure.
SSPC-A solenoid or circuit shorted to ground.
Voltage through SSPC-A solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to ground failure detected.
SSPC-A solenoid or circuit shorted to power.
Voltage through SSPC-A solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to power failure detected.
SSPC-B circuit, clutch or solenoid failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit open or TCM driver failure during on-board diagnostics.
SSPC-B circuit, clutch or solenoid - OFF.
SSPC-B circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the OFF position during operation resulting in LOW pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-B circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - ON.
SSPC-B circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the ON position during operation resulting in HIGH pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-B circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit failure or TCM driver failure.
SSPC-B solenoid or circuit shorted to ground.
Voltage through SSPC-B solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to ground failure detected.
SSPC-B solenoid or circuit shorted to power.
Voltage through SSPC-B solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to power failure detected.
SSPC-C circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit open or TCM drive failure during on-board diagnostics.
SSPC-C circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - OFF.
SSPC-C circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the OFF position during operation resulting in LOW pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-C circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - ON.
SSPC-C circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the ON position during operation resulting in HIGH pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-C circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit failure or TCM driver failure.
SSPC-C solenoid or circuit shorted to ground.
Voltage through SSPC-C solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to ground failure detected.
SSPC-C solenoid or circuit shorted to power.
Voltage through SSPC-C solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to power failure detected.
SSPC-D circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit open or TCM driver failure during on-board diagnostics.
SSPC-D circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - OFF.
SSPC-D circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the OFF position during operation resulting in HIGH pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-D circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - ON.
SSPC-D circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the ON position during operation resulting in LOW pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-D circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit failure or TCM driver failure.
SSPC-D solenoid or circuit shorted to ground.
Voltage through SSPC-D solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to ground failure detected.
SSPC-D solenoid or circuit shorted to power.
Voltage through SSPC-D solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to power failure detected.
SSPC-E circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit open or TCM drive failure during on-board diagnostics.
SSPC-E circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - OFF.
SSPC-E circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the ON position during operation resulting in LOW pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-E circuit, clutch or solenoid failure - ON.
SSPC-E circuit, clutch or solenoid failed in the OFF position during operation resulting in HIGH pressure in the hydraulic circuit.
SSPC-E circuit failed to provide voltage drop across solenoid. Circuit failure or TCM driver failure.
SSPC-E solenoid or circuit shorted to ground.
Voltage through SSPC-E solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to ground failure detected.
SSPC-E solenoid or circuit shorted to power.
Voltage through SSPC-E solenoid circuit is checked. An error will be noted if tolerance is exceeded. Short to power failure detected.
Insuff- icient input from intermed- iate shaft speed sensor.
TCM detected an insufficient signal from the intermediate shaft speed sensor during operation.
Harsh shifts or engagements, engine rpm higher or lower than expected. No 1st, 3rd or 5th gears.
No input from intermed- iate shaft speed sensor.
TCM detected a loss of intermediate shaft speed sensor signal during operation.
Harsh shifts or engagements, engine rpm higher or lower than expected. No 1st, 3rd or 5th gears.
Intermed- iate shaft speed sensor signal intermitt- ent.
TCM has detected an intermittent intermediate shaft speed sensor signal.
TCS switch input incorrect per selected position.
No Tow/Haul feature when TCS switch is pressed during self-test.
RERUN on-board diagnostics and cycle switch. If concern is still present, REFER to Automatic Transaxle/ Transmission External Controls.
a Output circuit check, generated only by electrical symptoms.
b May also generate by some other non-electrical transmission hardware system.
